title: Wonder Work
author: Wonder Work
content: Four years ago he thought Bitcoin price would never reach 100k. I think he had no idea about Bitcoin. A few days ago I saw a post like this, NotAeTher made a post, that is PeterSchiff said this a long time ago.PeterSchiff said it through his tweet that Bitcoin price will never reach 100k. It will just have to be a dream, he made such comments. I think he has no confidence in Bitcoin, he always says reactionary things.If I had something to say to him at this moment, I would say it in the language of a story (you must know the story of the tortoise and the hare. The hare, despite being a fast animal, lost to the slow tortoise). He wants to tell you that Bitcoin is a coin that has very good stability, without which the crypto market cannot be expected. It is not right for you to make such comments about it. We have seen many ups and downs in the market, but we are not disappointed at all because Bitcoin has gradually reached its milestone in the final stage.What kind of comments would you have made to Peter Schiff at this moment? Do you think he actually made this comment correctly?

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Wonder Work on December 05, 2024, 08:01:10 PMWhat kind of comments would you have made to Peter Schiff at this moment? Do you think he actually made this comment correctly?In most cases, I would just read through without giving a response, but if I must respond, I would say that he's entitled to his opinions, and it's okay to think as he wants.It most likely would have been very futile trying to convince somebody who already has a rigid opinion formed; the best thing in most cases is to allow time to tell, which it has done in this case. Time has shown everyone that someone as knowledgeable as Peter Schiff, who is a stockbroker, economist, and financial advisor, can be very wrong in their opinions. I hope he has now accepted the errors of his thinking.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: To be honest, I didn't know Peter Schiff before seeing these threads on Bitcointalk about him but I wouldn't be too quick to judge him for that tweet because we are humans and we make mistakes. Quick google result shows me that he is one of a few who accurately predicted the housing and financial crisis and he deservers a merit for that. We weren't 100% sure that Bitcoin ETFs would be approved, we weren't sure about many things. Now there is a war between Russia and Ukraine, this war probably also boosts the usage of Bitcoin (if you saw Putin's last interview, you know what I'm talking about).He made a mistake and that's all but my suggestion to every famous economist would be to not make a prediction out of thin air, it affects their reputation and they should be more careful when they predict something.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: I am not sure that even his fans and followers are taking him seriously when it comes to bitcoin. Peter Schiff is someone who has consistently been wrong about bitcoin for 17+ years, so maybe his tweets about bitcoin should be considered as reverse indicators. I am fairly sure that he doesn't ever get bullish on it, but when he does, i am definitely selling. Maybe in the future bitcoin has a major reversal from absolute ATH, but even that wouldn't mean he was right. That would just probably mean it fell for some unrelated reasons, like that economic growth wasn't infinite and actually had a top.

comments.author: headingnorth
comments.created_time: December 06, 2024, 07:16:02 PMLast edit: December 06, 2024, 10:28:03 PM by headingnorth
comments.body: The list of those who once held the same attitude as Peter Schiff is long. Michael Saylor, Donald Trump, Larry Fink, to name a few, all used to be extremely critical of bitcoin once thinking it was nothing but a ponzi or scam that had no value. But they have long since been orange-pilled and are now some of the biggest advocates of bitcoin in the world. One even became President of the United States! (again) Why? Because such people have an open mind, are open to new ideas and can admit they were wrong. And I have great respect for those who can admit they were wrong. I wish I can say the same for Peter Schiff. If Schiff had any valid criticisms of bitcoin then I could respect that, but he doesn't. He just continues to repeat the same old mindless talking points that he has been parroting for years. Like a broken record, it has become very old and stale. Schiff has nothing new or interesting to say, even after he has been proven wrong many times. That is the sure sign of a very closed-minded person.
